intro: Psychotria micheliae, commonly known as the Michelia Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Mexico and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland tropical forests. Psychotria micheliae is also notable for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
